channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Car parking on road dangerous, 24th February
item.description:
Increase in number of cars parked on road and traffic’s using road for the shop at the end of the road. The car parking reduces the visibility and space for turning at the bend. This lead to a traffic accident in the summer. A car was coming down the road to use the turning space adjacent to the bend whilst another car came around the bend and due to parked vehicles couldn’t see the oncoming vehicle that was in the middle of the road .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stancombe View, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes, 24th February
item.description:
Potholes from cirencester junction to Tewkesbury in various lanes, particularly the outside lane, been like it for months and the potholes are getting worse, a few times I've seen people swerve to try and miss them
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: Road Disintegration, 23rd February
item.description:
The section of Kyderminster Road by the junction with Norton and Huddleston is now almost impassible due to the volume and depth of potholes. There are very few drivable areas. I know this has been repeated already but nothing has been done and it is dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kyderminster Road, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury

item.title: Third time I’ve reported the potholes along Hayden Road in Cheltenham, 23rd February
item.description:
This is the third time I’ve reported these potholes. I keep getting emails to say they have been fixed but they haven’t. Hayden road is extremely bad for driving along. There are multiple potholes, some are really deep and some are extremely wide, hard to navigate your way thorough. They are in the lane and in the middle of the road along the white line so there is no way of avoiding them. People, including myself, I have also seen 4x4s swerve to avoid them so you can only imagine how bad they are. Someone is either going to have damage caused to their tyres or there is going to be an accident from where people have to swerve. The speed limit along the road is 40mph but to drive down that road safely, people are having to drive less than 10mph. These potholes NEED fixing before someone’s dies or someone has to pay an extortionate amount to get their car fixed. I thought Gloucestershire was green for fixing potholes? Stop lying saying you’ve filled them in when they haven’t even been touched
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
